answers.text: ontology that "understands becoming as a relational process; difference as being related, yet unique; and the purpose of becoming as harmonizing difference."

qas.question: What book did Stout and Jeanine M. Love author that does not examine between Whitehead and Follett?

context: Margaret Stout and Carrie M. Staton have also written recently on the mutual influence of Whitehead and Mary Parker Follett, a <a0_0><b3_0>pioneer in the fields of organizational theory and organizational behavior<b3_0/><a0_0/>. Stout and Staton see both Whitehead and Follett as sharing an <a1_0><b4_0>ontology that "understands becoming as a relational process; difference as being related, yet unique; and the purpose of becoming as harmonizing difference<b4_0/>."<a1_0/> This connection is further analyzed by Stout and Jeannine M. Love in <a2_0><b5_0>Integrative Process: Follettian Thinking from Ontology to Administration<b5_0/><a2_0/>
